Company: American Modern Insurance Group, Inc. et al.
Description: American Modern Insurance Group, plus subsidiaries including American Family Home Insurance Co., American Western Home Insurance Co, American Southern Home Insurance Co. and Midwest Enterprises, Inc. dba Ameritrac, agreed to pay a $1 million civil penalty plus refunds to customers in settlement of allegations they did business in Force-Placed Insurance while paying improper rebates to Servicers, charging excessive premiums, and providing inaccurate information to the Department of Commerce.

Info Source: AMERICAN MODERN HOME AND AMERICAN FAMILY HOME INSURANCE COMPANIES TO ISSUE $1.6M IN REFUNDS, US State News, December 5, 2012 (via Nexis).

Agency: New York Department of Financial Services
New York Department of Financial Services

Company: American Alternative Insurance Corporation et al.
Description: Fine levied for using unfiled rates. RCW 48.19.040(6); 48.05.185; 48.19.430
Agency: Washington State Office of the Insurance Commissioner

Description: Company fined for issuing to Washington consumers 62 forms that had not been properly filed and approved by the Insurance Commissioner. RCW 48.18.100(1); RCW 48.18.100(5).
Agency: Washington State Office of the Insurance Commissioner

Description: Fine levied for issuing to Washington consumers 11 policies that had a form that not been properly filed and approved by the Insurance Commissioner, and failing to respond promptly to an inquiry from the Insurance Commissioner relative to the business of insurance within fifteen business days from r...
Agency: Washington State Office of the Insurance Commissioner

Description: American Modern agreed to make a $255,000 administrative payment to a group of states as part of the resolution of issues raised during an examination of its market conduct relating to travel insurance.

American Modern agreed to pay $12 million, with half suspended if it met certain conditions,  to resolve a multistate examination that found potential charges in excess of approved rates for lender-placed products.
